alert.note: Alert for Indiana; Westmoreland (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 22 at 7:23PM EDT until June 22 at 10:15PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR EAST CENTRAL WESTMORELAND AND CENTRAL INDIANA COUNTIES... At 723 PM EDT, Radar indicated that heavy rain had diminished across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is still possible due to runoff from the heavier rain. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Indiana, Homer City, Blairsville, Black Lick, Clymer, New Florence, Chevy Chase Heights, Seward, Bolivar, Ernest, Creekside, Armagh, Lucerne Mines, Jacksonville, Dixonville, Commodore, Brush Vly and Yellow Creek State Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
